jchess.ruleengine

Class ThreePlayersHexBoardRuleProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchess.ruleengine.DefaultRuleProcessor
      • jchess.ruleengine.ExtendedRuleProcessor
        • jchess.ruleengine.ThreePlayersHexBoardRuleProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRuleProcessor

    public class ThreePlayersHexBoardRuleProcessor
extends ExtendedRuleProcessor
    This class extends ExtendedRuleProcessor class and provides specialized functionalities, in addition to those provided by ExtendedRuleProcess, peculiar to 3-Players (Hexagon) Chess-board. It process all the custom operations that are solely related to 3-Players (Hexagon) Chess-board. It includes finding out possible move candidates for custom pieces and the execution of these rules. It helps the engine in facilitating the rules that are not supported by XML.
    Since:
    19 Jan 2020
    Author:
    Sajad Karim

      This method checks whether the position meets the requirements defined in the rule to be a possible move candidate, and it also finds out whether to seize the search process or not.
      void tryEvaluateAllRules(IBoardAgent oBoard, IPieceAgent oPiece, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,IMoveCandidate> mpCandidatePositions)
      This method finds out whether the provided position can be a candidate position to make a move, and it also (with the help of the rule) deduces whether algorithm should proceed with the position to find out the next possible candidate moves.
